sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The NetBSD Project provides a variety of public mailing lists to facilitate communication between the users and developers of NetBSD. All of the mailing lists are served by the Majordomo mailing list management package, and you can find out more about how to use the NetBSD Project's Majordomo by mailing majordomo@NetBSD.org with an empty message body.

Using this page, you can find out what the various mailing lists are for, look at the mailing list archives, and even subscribe to the mailing lists themselves. This page is broken up into three sections: this introductory section; an index of the mailing lists for quick reference; and the descriptions of the mailing lists, along with links to allow you to look at their archives and subscribe to them.

itemizedlist.listitem:
To subscribe to a mailing list click on the
Subscribe
link next to its name, in the description section of this page. You will then have to fill out a form, to supply your e-mail address.
To unsubscribe from a mailing list> send an email message from the address by which you are subscribed to containing only the message unsubscribe listname.

To obtain a mailing list archive click on the
View archive
link next to its name, in the description section of this page. This will take you to the mail archive server mail-index.NetBSD.org. (Many thanks to the ISC for the network access and rack space for this machine as well as Tim Rightnour for building and maintaining the site..). An alternative index of our mailing lists is available at the MARC list archives.

To read the list through a news frontend click on the
newsgroup
link next to its name, in the description section of this page. This will take you to the news-archive gmane.org.

sect1.para: Please note that while the majority of the NetBSD mailing lists are normally unmoderated, there are circumstances which will occasionally cause a mailing list to be moderated by its manager.

sect1.title: Searchable mailing list archives
sect1.para:
Indexes and archives are provided on
and at the MARC list archives.
Quick search the mailing lists with Google (other NetBSD searches)

listitem.formalpara: current-users This is a forum for all people using an up-to-date version of the NetBSD-current source tree. It is a good forum for talking about `gotchas' in the tree. Since the NetBSD-current tree is a quickly moving target, please confirm any problems with the latest tree before posting.
netbsd-advocacy This mailing list is for open discussion on how to promote the project.
netbsd-announce This mailing list is for announcements about NetBSD.
netbsd-bugs This mailing list is where you can discuss bugs in NetBSD. All NetBSD bug reports sent with &man.send-pr.1; appear here.
pkgsrc-bugs All bug reports in category pkg sent with &man.send-pr.1; appear here. This mailing list is where you can discuss bugs in pkgsrc. Please do not report your bugs here.
netbsd-docs This mailing list is for discussing NetBSD documentation.
netbsd-docs-de This mailing list is for discussing the German translation of NetBSD docs.
netbsd-docs-es This mailing list is for discussing the Spanish translation of NetBSD docs.
netbsd-docs-fr This mailing list is for discussing the French translation of NetBSD docs.
netbsd-docs-nl This mailing list is for discussing the Dutch translation of NetBSD docs.
netbsd-docs-se This mailing list is for discussing the Swedish translation of NetBSD docs.
netbsd-docs-ru This mailing list is for discussing the Russian translation of NetBSD docs.
netbsd-docs-zh_cn This mailing list is for discussing the simplified Chinese translation of NetBSD docs.
netbsd-docs-zh_tw This mailing list is for discussing the traditional Chinese translation of NetBSD docs.
netbsd-help This list provides a general help forum where users can ask questions.
netbsd-java This is a forum for discussing issues related to Java on NetBSD.
netbsd-jobs This mailing list is for job advertisements relevant to NetBSD users and developers.
netbsd-news This mailing list is for news about NetBSD, including from third parties.
netbsd-ports This list is for people working on or generally interested in ports of NetBSD to various types of computers.

netbsd-users This is a general purpose forum for all NetBSD users, regardless of platform. As a large number of subscribers receive this list, please use your good judgement when posting. Questions or comments about the maintenance or design of NetBSD itself, as opposed to issues related to using NetBSD, aren't appropriate to this list, and are better voiced in a more narrowly focused technical list.
pkgsrc-bulk This mailing list receives reports and build logs of pkgsrc bulk builds.

pkgsrc-changes This list is for those who are interested in getting a commit message for every change committed to the NetBSD Packages Collection (pkgsrc). It is also available in digest form, meaning one daily message containing all commit messages for changes to the package source tree in that 24 hour period.

source-changes This list is for those who are interested in getting a commit message for every change committed to the NetBSD source tree. It is also available in digest form, meaning one daily message containing all commit messages for changes to the source tree in that 24 hour period.
regional-au Discussion relevant to users in Australia.
regional-boston Discussion relevant to users in Boston, USA.
regional-ca Discussion relevant to users in Canada.
regional-cs Discussion relevant to users in Czech Republic & Slovak Republic.
regional-de Discussion relevant to users in Germany and other German speaking countries.
regional-fr Discussion relevant to users in France.
regional-it Discussion relevant to users in Italy.
regional-jp Discussion relevant to users in Japan.
regional-london Discussion relevant to users in London, UK.
regional-nl Discussion relevant to users in the Netherlands.
regional-nordic Discussion relevant to users in the Scandinavian countries.
regional-nyc Discussion relevant to users in New York City, USA.
regional-pl Discussion relevant to users in Poland.
regional-pt Discussion relevant to users in Portugal and other Portuguese speaking countries.
regional-sfba Discussion relevant to users in the San Francisco Bay Area, USA.
tech-cluster Technical discussion on building and using clusters of NetBSD hosts.
tech-embed Discussions about using NetBSD in embedded systems.

tech-install Technical discussion of improvements to NetBSD's installation software. NOTE: This mailing list is not for assistance with installing NetBSD. If you have problems installing NetBSD, see netbsd-help instead!
tech-kern Discussion of general technical kernel issues.
tech-misc Discussion of technical issues that aren't really appropriate for any of the other tech-* lists.
tech-net Discussion of technical issues relating to NetBSD's networking subsystem.
tech-perform Discussion of performance issues in NetBSD, especially ways to improve performance.
tech-pkg Discussion of technical issues related to the NetBSD package system.
tech-ports Discussion of technical issues related to porting NetBSD to different hardware.
tech-security Technical discussion regarding security issues in NetBSD.
tech-crypto Technical discussion regarding cryptography in the NetBSD system. This list applies to both US-based (cryptosrc-us) and International (cryptosrc-intl) available cryptography.
tech-smp Discussion of technical issues relating to multi-processor support for NetBSD.
tech-toolchain Technical discussion of toolchain and build system issues.
tech-userlevel Discussion of non-kernel related technical issues, such as POSIX compliance, compilation environment, etc.
tech-x11 Discussion of the X11 window system as used with NetBSD.
www-changes This list is for those who are interested in getting a commit message for every change committed to the NetBSD WWW server's documents.
port-acorn26 Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on ARMv2 and ARMv2a machines (NetBSD/acorn26). There is also a port-arm list for questions related to all ARM based ports.
port-acorn32 Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on ARM6 and newer based machines (NetBSD/acorn32). There is also a port-arm list for questions related to all ARM based ports.
port-algor Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Algorithmics, Ltd. MIPS-based evaluation boards (NetBSD/algor). There is also a port-mips list for questions related to all MIPS based ports.
port-alpha Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Digital's Alpha AXP systems (NetBSD/alpha).
port-amd64 Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on AMD64 based machines (NetBSD/amd64).

port-amiga Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Commodore's Amiga and MacroSystem's DraCo machines (NetBSD/amiga). There is also a port-m68k list for questions related to all Motorola 68k based ports. This list supersedes the amiga, amiga-dev, and amiga-x lists.
port-arc Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on MIPS based PCs with ARC firmware (NetBSD/arc). There is also a port-mips list for questions related to all MIPS based ports.

port-arm Discussion of issues relevant to all ARM-based NetBSD ports. There are lists for the individual ports and they should be used for port-specific questions and information: port-acorn26, port-acorn32, port-cats, and port-hpcarm.
port-atari Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Atari's TT030, Falcon, and Hades machines (NetBSD/atari). There is also a port-m68k list for questions related to all Motorola 68k based ports.
port-bebox Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Be, Inc.'s PowerPC based BeBox computer (NetBSD/bebox). There is also a port-powerpc list for questions related to all PowerPC based ports.

port-cats Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on ARM based Chalice Technology CATS machines and EBSA evaluation boards (NetBSD/cats). There is also a port-arm list for questions related to all ARM based ports.
port-cobalt Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Cobalt Networks MIPS based Qube and RaQ computers (NetBSD/cobalt). There is also a port-mips list for questions related to all MIPS based ports.
port-dreamcast Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Sega Dreamcast (NetBSD/dreamcast). There is also a port-sh3 list for questions related to all Hitachi Super-H (SH3/4) chips-based ports.

port-evbmips Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on evaluation boards with MIPS-based CPUs (NetBSD/evbmips). Currently the MIPS Malta is supported. There is also a port-mips list for questions related to all MIPS based ports.

port-hp300 Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Hewlett-Packard's 9000/300 and 9000/400 series machines (NetBSD/hp300). There is also a port-m68k list for questions related to all Motorola 68k based ports.
port-hp700 Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Hewlett-Packard's 9000/700 HP-PA RISC machines (NetBSD/hp700).
port-hpcarm Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on ARM based Windows CE PDA machines (NetBSD/hpcarm). There is also a port-arm list for questions related to all ARM based ports.
port-hpcmips Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on MIPS based Windows CE PDA machines (NetBSD/hpcmips). There is also a port-mips list for questions related to all MIPS based ports.

port-hpcsh Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Hitachi Super-H (SH3/4) family based Windows CE PDA machines (NetBSD/hpcsh). There is also a port-sh3 list for questions related to all Hitachi Super-H (SH3/4) based ports.
port-i386 Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on IBM PC clones with i386 or better CPUs (NetBSD/i386).
port-iyonix Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on the ARM based Iyonix pc (NetBSD/iyonix).
port-luna68k Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on 68k based OMRON LUNA machines (NetBSD/luna68k). There is also a port-m68k list for questions related to all Motorola 68k based ports.

port-m68k Discussion of issues relevant to all m68k-based NetBSD ports. There are lists for the individual ports and they should be used for port-specific questions and information: port-amiga, port-atari, port-hp300, port-luna68k, port-mac68k, port-mvme68k, port-news68k, port-next68k, port-sun2, port-sun3, and port-x68k.

port-mac68k Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Apple's m68k based Macintosh machines (NetBSD/mac68k). There is also a port-m68k list for questions related to all Motorola 68k based ports. This list supersedes both the macbsd-general and macbsd-development lists.
port-macppc Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Apple's PowerPC based Macintosh machines (NetBSD/macppc). There is also a port-powerpc list for questions related to all PowerPC based ports.

port-mips Discussion of issues relevant to all MIPS-based NetBSD ports. There are lists for the individual ports and they should be used for port-specific questions and information: port-algor, port-arc, port-cobalt, port-evbmips, port-hpcmips, port-mipsco, port-newsmips, port-playstation2, port-pmax, port-sbmips. and port-sgimips.
port-mipsco Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on products of MIPS Computer Systems, Inc. (NetBSD/mipsco) There is also a port-mips list for questions related to all MIPS based ports.
port-mvme68k Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Motorola's 68k VME board computers (NetBSD/mvme68k). There is also a port-m68k list for questions related to all Motorola 68k based ports.
port-mvmeppc Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Motorola's PowerPC VME board computers (NetBSD/mvmeppc). There is also a port-powerpc list for questions related to all PowerPC based ports.
port-news68k Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on 68k based Sony NEWS systems (NetBSD/news68k). There is also a port-m68k list for questions related to all Motorola 68k based ports.
port-newsmips Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on MIPS based Sony NEWS systems (NetBSD/newsmips). There is also a port-mips list for questions related to all MIPS based ports.
port-next68k Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on 68k based NeXT black hardware (NetBSD/next68k). There is also a port-m68k list for questions related to all Motorola 68k based ports.
port-ofppc Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on OpenFirmware PowerPC systems (NetBSD/ofppc). There is also a port-powerpc list for questions related to all PowerPC based ports.
port-pc532 Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on the rather rare PC532 computer (NetBSD/pc532).
port-pdp10 Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on DEC PDP-10 computer (NetBSD/pdp10).
port-playstation2 Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Sony's Playstation 2 machines (NetBSD/playstation2). There is also a port-mips list for questions related to all MIPS based ports.

port-pmax Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Digital's MIPS based DECstation and DECsystem machines (NetBSD/pmax). There is also a port-mips list for questions related to all MIPS based ports.

port-powerpc Discussion of issues relevant to all PowerPC based NetBSD ports. There are lists for the individual ports and they should be used for port-specific questions and information: port-bebox, port-macppc, port-mvmeppc, port-ofppc, port-prep, and port-sandpoint.
port-prep Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on PReP -- PowerPC Reference Platform (NetBSD/prep). There is also a port-powerpc list for questions related to all PowerPC based ports.
port-s390 Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on IBM S/390 platforms (NetBSD/s390).

port-sandpoint Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Motorola Sandpoint reference platform using the MPC8240 processor module (NetBSD/sandpoint). There is also a port-powerpc list for questions related to all PowerPC based ports.

port-sbmips Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Broadcom's SiByte Broadband Processor-based platforms (NetBSD/sbmips). There is also a port-mips list for questions related to all MIPS based ports.
port-sgimips Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on SGI MIPS platforms (NetBSD/sgimips). There is also a port-mips list for questions related to all MIPS based ports.

port-sh3 Discussion of issues relevant to all Hitachi Super-H (SH3/4) chips-based NetBSD ports. There are lists for the individual ports and they should be used for port-specific questions and information: port-dreamcast, and port-hpcsh.
port-sh5 Discussion of issues relevant to all SH5-based NetBSD ports.
port-sparc Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Sun's 32-bit Sparc based machines (NetBSD/sparc).
port-sparc64 Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Sun's 64-bit Ultrasparc based machines (NetBSD/sparc64).

port-sun2 Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Sun's Motorola 68010 based machines (NetBSD/sun2). Newer Sun machines are covered on port-sun3, port-sparc and port-sparc64. There is also a port-m68k list for questions related to all Motorola 68k based ports.

port-sun3 Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Sun's Motorola 68020 (sun3) and 68030 (sun3x) based machines (NetBSD/sun3). Newer Sparc based Sun machines are covered on port-sparc and port-sparc64. There is also a port-m68k list for questions related to all Motorola 68k based ports.
port-vax Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Digital's VAX series of machines (NetBSD/vax).
port-x68k Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on Sharp's Japanese X68000/X68030 machines (NetBSD/x68k). There is also a port-m68k list for questions related to all Motorola 68k based ports.
port-xen Discussion of issues specific to NetBSD on the Xen Virtual Machine Monitor (NetBSD/xen).
amiga This list was for discussing NetBSD/amiga issues. It has been obsoleted by port-amiga.
amiga-dev This list was for issues related to the further development of NetBSD/amiga. It has been obsoleted by port-amiga.
amiga-x This list was for those running X under NetBSD/amiga. It has been obsoleted by port-amiga.
m68k This list was for those interested in issues relevant to all m68k-family CPU based ports. It has been obsoleted by port-m68k.
macbsd-development This list was for issues related to the further development of MacBSD. It has been obsoleted by port-mac68k.
macbsd-general This list was for discussing MacBSD (NetBSD/mac68k) issues. It has been obsoleted by port-mac68k.
